intro: Cassine oppositifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cassine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in countries like Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple, and usually ovate to lanceolate leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Cassine oppositifolia is often found in moist, shaded environments such as along riverbanks and in tropical forests.
